articles.title: Repeal of Bill on Overseas Dispatch of Troops Demanded in S. Korea
WPK Birthday Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
Repeal of Bill on Overseas Dispatch of Troops Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- The People's Action against the Troop Dispatch in south Korea reportedly held a press conference near the building of the "National Assembly" on Oct. 13 to denounce the authorities' moves to railroad the "bill on peace-keeping activities" through the NA.
 A press release read out at the press conference recalled that 34 lawmakers from ruling and opposition parties submitted to the Unification, Foreign Affairs and Trade Committee of the NA on Sept. 2 the bill on dispatching overseas the south Korean troops without any approval of the NA under the pretext of rapidly meeting the UN's request for troop dispatch.
 The press release branded this bill as a dangerous one aimed at reducing the south Korean troops to units serving the U.S. troops dispatched overseas, going beyond the framework of peace-keeping activities.    
 It continued:    
 The authorities sent troops to the U.S. unjust war of aggression against Iraq under the pretext of the "UN's request" and agreed with the U.S. to define "peace-keeping activities and emergency rescue from disaster" as new duties stipulated in the south Korea-U.S. "alliance." These facts prove that the bill is aimed at legally backing the increasing role of the U.S. troops in south Korea according to the U.S. strategy for dominating the world. 
 If the authorities are to genuinely contribute to the international community, they should immediately repeal the unconstitutional bill and take a substantial action for peace.

articles.title: DPRK Will Make Positive Contribution to International Efforts for Global Peace
WPK Hailed
articles.content:
DPRK Will Make Positive Contribution to International Efforts for Global Peace 
    Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government will in the future, too, make a positive contribution to the international efforts for global peace by strengthening cooperation with the UNESCO and all its member nations in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, said the head of the DPRK delegation to the 33rd meeting of the General Conference of the UNESCO on Oct. 7.
 History books beautifying the Japanese history of aggression quite contrary to the mission of education to implant the spirit of peace in the people and the spirit of the foundation charter of the UNESCO are still included in the curriculums of education for rising generations in Japan which inflicted war holocaust on humankind in the past, which touches off a serious apprehension among the Asian countries, he said, and continued:
 The reality requires to enhance the function and role of the UNESCO whose mission is to provide the intellectual foundation of peace and equality through international cooperation in the fields of education, science and culture.    
 He expressed the expectation that the UNESCO will boost cooperation among its member states in its activities in the new period, too, and fulfil its responsibility and role as an intellectual organization conducive to world peace, security and sustained development.    
 In recent years the DPRK is directing great efforts to educational, scientific and technical development and the preservation and management of national cultural heritages in accordance with the government's policy of attaching great importance to education and science, he noted.
 He said that the U.S. has persistently pursued unreasonable pressure and unprecedented economic blockade for more than a half century from the sense of rejection of the system of the DPRK, which laid big obstacles in the universal development of the country including educational, scientific and cultural fields.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Significant Celebration of WPK Birthday
articles.content:
WPK Hailed 
    Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Socialist Party of Benin-Baanitee took place in Cotonou on Oct. 5 on the occasion of the 60th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 According to a proposal of Ali Houdou, chairman of the SCB, the meeting unanimously decided to extend full support and encouragement to the WPK which has led to victory the struggle of the Korean people to frustrate the imperialists' moves for interference and stifling the DPRK and defend the dignity of the Korean nation and the sovereignty of the country, holding high the banner of Songun under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
 It also decided to continue to have close ties with the authoritative and veteran WPK which has gained rich experience over the last 60 years.
 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Idea of "By Our Nation Itself"
Kim Yong Nam Meets Nigerian Government Delegation
Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Pakistani Ambassador
Flocks of Pheasants Released in DPRK
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Pakistani Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday met and had a talk with new Pakistani Ambassador to the DPRK Noorullah Khan who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
 On hand were officials concerned and an official of the Pakistani embassy here.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Head of Nigerian Delegation
articles.content:
Flocks of Pheasants Released in DPRK
    Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- Flocks of pheasants have been set free in hills of cities and counties of North Hwanghae Province, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
 The number of pheasants released this fall amounts to over 10,000 in Munmu-ri of Sohung County and Sangha-ri of Rinsan County of the province.
 The province, in response to the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea on protecting and propagating useful animals and plants, has bred animals including pheasants and roe deer to be set free.    
 The number of roe deer, pheasants and other animals released in the province for nearly 20 years runs to hundreds of thousands.
 Roe deer, pheasants and other useful animals can be seen in mountains, fields and even in roadsides of the province.

articles.title: Traitorous Diatribe of Dong-A Ilbo Blasted
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Head of Nigerian Delegation
    Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the head of the visiting Nigerian government delegation.
 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Mallam Nasir Ahmad El-Rufai, minister of Federal Capital Territory who is heading the Nigerian government delegation, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from President of Democratic Congo
Kim Jong Il Inspects KPA Unit
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from President of Democratic Congo
    Pyongyang October 19 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Joseph Kabila, president of Democratic Congo.
 The gift was handed to an official concerned on Oct. 18 by Masamba Eme, secretary for Public Relations of the General Federation of Workers' Trade Unions of Democratic Congo, who is heading its delegation on a visit to the DPRK.
